resources.string: Travel to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Acquire {itemName}
Craft {itemName}
Crashing the Wake
The Mourningdale settlement has been struck by tragedy and is in disarray. Constable Bayles will fill you in.
"Why is everything so terrible?"

It's a tragic state of affairs. Our much-adored Watcher, Antonio Guerra, has fallen and become one of the Lost. \n\nAngharad Wallace is taking it particularly hard, the poor woman... her heart is shattered to pieces.
"I'm sorry for your loss."

Well, and that's not all. My adviser, Gildon, has lost her second-sight - it's saved us more times than I can count. \n\nIf you would help, speak to Survivalist Fletcher. She's the only one clear-headed right now.
If you want to help us, speak to Fletcher.
You spoke to the Constable? Good. Bayles is a kind soul, but his mind falters.\n\nHonestly, I don't have the answers either, but I wonder if an outsider might offer a fresh perspective.
"I can try. Where do I start?"
The best I can suggest now is just to talk to them - Gildon and Wallace, I mean.\n\nIf the Corruption is coming, we need both of them in top form, and right now, that is most certainly not the case.
Talk to Fletcher
Abandoned Duties
Defeat the former Watcher Antonio Guerra, find any mementos at his camp, and put his soul to rest. Then report back to Magistrate Wallace in the Mourningdale Settlement.
"Is that what he would've wanted?"

Sorry, I shouldn't pour my heart out to a stranger. It's just that Tony… our Watcher was our champion.\n\nI'm trying to be strong, but I just can't. Not with Tony still… wandering around out there, Lost.
"Is there anything I can do?"

I...I can hardly bring myself to say it, but yes… if you're willing to visit the Watchtower and put Tony to rest... it's all we can do.\n\nIf you find any personal items… I should like to have those too.
Please, do try to be gentle, but of course, do what must be done. \n\nTony was a good Watcher, and a good man. His soul deserves rest.
His spyglass…? Oh dear, he… he kept it so clean. He was a man of such integrity.\n\nIt was a gift, you know, this spyglass. I still remember the day I gave it to him. We were so happy then…
"How did he become a Lost?"
He carried the weight of this settlement on his shoulders. He put on a strong face, but his fears were deeper than I knew. \n\nThat's the hardest part, of course… that I was so oblivious.
Put Antonio Guerra to rest and find any mementos at his camp
Defeat Antonio Guerra
Search the camp for Guerra's Spyglass
Tears of a Wraith
Defeat Spirits at Stephen's Claim to Collect Teardrop Gems. Then report back to Artificer Wrightson in the Mourningdale Settlement.
"Business is bad?"
Bad? More like non-existent! I don't craft things so they can rot on the shelf!\n\nArt is only useful when it's being used, when it's being purchased!
"Anything I can do to help?"

string.comment: Male referring to group of deceased Males (Stephen and his party)
string.speaker: Artificer Wrightson - Mourningdale
string.name: ArtificerWrightson

resources.string: Buy something, or... you could help shore up our savings by visiting Stephen's Claim.\n\nThe wraiths there supposedly carry Teardrop Gems - very valuable. Get the gems, and we'll share the profits.
Legend suggests the Teardrop Gems are a crystallization of tears from the weeping Wraiths that haunt the mine. \n\nBut I don't buy it. Do ghosts even have tear ducts? I think not.
Ah, exquisite! The gems are virtually colorless, almost haunting. \n\nMaybe all that wailing in the mines really does lead to better quality gems?
"You can sell these?"
Not right away, but I can incorporate them in jewelry and other trinkets that will sell when this all blows over.\n\nHere, I think this is fair reward for your work in acquisition.
Collect Teardrop Gems from spirits at Stephen's Claim
Defeat Wraiths at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} to Collect a Teardrop Gem
Defeat {targetName} to Collect a Teardrop Gem
Defeat {targetName} to Collect a Teardrop Gem
Excommunicated Gold
Recover the gold medallions from Padre Nuñez at his Mansion. Then report back to Artificer Wrightson in the Mourningdale Settlement.
"I'm {playerName}."

It's nice to make your acquaintance - I sense that you take a longterm perspective, unlike the others here.\n\nIf you're interested in another venture - I know where we can score some gold medallions.
"Where would that be?"

There was a Padre named Nuñez who recruited followers to a cult in his Mansion here.\n\nThe silver-tongued padre had gold on his mind however. He hoarded those medallions in a small chest he kept near him, always.
Padre Nuñez was both eccentric and dangerous.\n\nTake care when you visit the Mansion.
Ah, yes! These medallions will melt down quite nicely. Nuñez cost this settlement so much.\n\nIt's only fair that his treasures should now go to support us in our hour of need.
"Is this gold for the settlement or you?"
Why, do you take me for some type of charlatan like the padre? Nothing could be less true.\n\nI will take a commission, but the rest goes to the settlement, and of course, some to you, as well.
Recover gold medallions from Padre Nuñez at the {POITags}
Defeat Padre Nuñez
Recover the Padre's key
Retrieve medallions from the Padre's chest
Chasing Waterfalls
Clear Weeper enemies from Porridgepot. Then report back to Constable Bayles in the Mourningdale Settlement.
"What concerns are those?"
I'm afraid my time as Constable nears an end. I can't solve Mourningdale's problems any more.\n\nMy body appears middle-aged, but I am actually one of the oldest people on the island.
"How old are you?"

So old, I cannot remember... or even think clearly. I just need a quiet place to retire.\n\nThere's a cottage in Porridgepot with a beautiful waterfall. If you could clear out the Weepers, it might be perfect for me.
Clear Weeper enemies from Porridgepot
Clear Weepers
I need a place where I can just go and sit quietly, undisturbed.\n\nThe cottage and the waterfall seem to be calling my name.
Tell me, how was it out in Porridgepot? \n\nIt seems silly coming from one as old as I am, but I actually feel a little excited about the place.
"The Weepers keep coming."
Oh… that's disappointing. One gets to an age where a quiet, secluded place matters almost more than anything.\n\nPerhaps… well, I do still have options. Thank you, my friend. I see clearly now.
Après Moi, le Déluge
Investigate the ruins in the Flooded Plains, and return found artifacts to Gildon in Mourningdale.
"Are you alright?"
Wait... shifting dimensions bring something into focus. It's YOU! \n\nIn your eyes, I see it clearly. The waters rise and drown the settlement. I too am drowned, pulled under…
"Are you seeing the future?"
No, child. No. It is not the future, but the past. Truths drowned, hiding away ancient sins, curses.\n\nYou. You must visit the Ancient ruins here in Mourningdale and bring back whatever you find.
Standing on the edge of the water, we see a reflection of ourselves in its surface.\n\nAnd that is what obscures the truth that lies beneath.
Ah, the orbs... do you hear them? The whispers? \n\nThey speak in a language I do not know, but the words bring a tear to my eye, nonetheless.
"Is it a lost memory?"

I see it with my eyes, not my mind - visions of a flood, drowned secrets, and lost history…\n\nI've written this for you. Read it and let Its truth guide you. I must rest. This vision gnaws at my soul.
Search for artifacts in the ruins of {POITags}
Locate and collect the {itemName}
Search for artifacts in the ruins of {POITags}
Locate and collect the {itemName}
Search for artifacts in the ruins of {POITags}
Locate and collect the {itemName}
Road to Truth
Defeat Novaguard foot soldiers in the lookouts along the Ancient Road, and give their armor scraps to Gildon in Mourningdale.
"What can I do?"
I see fragments… the stones of a road, north and south.\n\nThe stones are sealed with an undying light, azoth… and the Guardians walk the road in an endless journey.
"Should I visit this road?"
Yes. The lookouts... the rattle of bone, a watchful eye, their humanity removed, their death denied...\n\nIt is a protection they lack - their armor. That's what I need. The Novaguard armor.
The tattered cloth and the dull gold of the lookouts' armor are but fragments of their past.\n\nIt's that past I need to grasp.
Armor in tatters, they still stand guard and protect the road. \n\nAn endless duty, but perhaps one not chosen. Yes, not a duty, but a shackle. They are not free, and they never were.
"The Ancient Guardians?"
I believe so... the bone faces reflect the will of the stone... statues with more faces than one. \n\nAnd arms, in multitudes. They need not see that which they can hold.
Collect cloth scraps from Novaguard foot soldiers at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and Collect {itemName}
Collect armor scraps from Novaguard foot soldiers at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and Collect {itemName}
Ancient Truths, Ancient Lies
Defeat Fineseer foot soldiers while climbing to the top of Vela, and show its treasure to Gildon in Mourningdale.
"Do you need anything else?"
Indeed, you are bound too, {playerName}. You bring blinding light to blinding darkness. \n\nA Watchtower, ancient and powerful, is your next destination. Vela. A treasure you seek, at its peak.
"What treasure?"
An object from a darkened sky, akin to night, stars above, and a blinding light…\n\nGo to the top of Vela, and bring me any relic of the Fineseers you find there.
The watchers in the tower, what is it they watched for?\n\nIs it the same now as it was then?
My sight grows stronger as you appear, and what did you find... a spyglass? An object that gives a view across Mourningdale.\n\nBut through this spyglass, I see not across space, but across time…
"What do you see?"
Blue lights across the Aeternum, like constellations of the earth. But then, in the south, the light blinds, a shattering of stone.\n\nHere. Take this page, and my observations.
Claim the relic hidden atop Vela
Defeat {targetName} skeletons
Defeat {targetName} for his {itemName}
Razor to the Beard
Defeat Musslebeard and the Seasong pirates in his charge. Then report back to Magistrate Wallace in Mourningdale.
"To destroy the settlement?"
Exactly. Watcher Guerra had observed a new level of organization, of purpose, among the Lost Pirates.\n\nThe infamous Musslebeard leads them as he did in life. They're making preparations even now.
"Where are they?"
Down by the shore, in Musslebeard's cove. Tony apparently tried and failed to fight them.\n\nI hesitate to ask, but if you can't defeat Musslebeard, I fear no one can. Please, help us.
Tony's Journal suggest he secretly attacked Musslebeard's cove several times.\n\nIt seems he was defeated one time too many. I wish I had known.
Did you do the deed, then? Did you avenge my Antonio and destroy Musslebeard?\n\nIt's like a salve to my embattled soul. Honestly, until now, I seriously considered joining him.
"You can't. Mourningdale needs you."
I see that now. Perhaps in some way, it was Tony's sacrifice that gave us the warning of how dire things had become. \n\nThank you, for helping to remedy this, and restoring my hope.
Defeat Musslebeard and the Seasong pirates of {POITags}
Defeat members of Musslebeard's {targetName} crew
Defeat Musslebeard
Corrupted Energy
Defeat the Redeyes and destroy Spewspitter's emblem in New Balefire, then return to Gildon in Mourningdale.
"The Corruption?"
I believe so - I believe it was that which assaulted my mind with a chorus of ancient screams.\n\nBut you have restored a measure of quiet and the clarity. I see now what must be done.
"What is it then?"

My sight is limited by a pervasive influence, attempting to seal our fate in Mourningdale.\n\nIt's a Totem at the Bahia, a nexus of evil. It is your destiny to destroy it, {playerName}. Go and do so, with haste.
The Corruption cannot be permitted to spread here.\n\nIt is up to you to stop it.

You succeeded! That Corruption Totem was blinding and pained me in the deepest parts of my soul.\n\n It projected a timeless promise of violence and conquest... when you destroyed it, I saw its truth.
"What did you see?"
I saw blue turned red by an ever-consuming flame, the lighthouse on the shore, calling like a siren's song.\n\nIt must be what calls people there and it Corrupts them.
"We have to stop it."
Yes, but I have seen and said enough - the work here, as it has, belongs to you.\n\nI have warned Magistrate Wallace of what I've seen. The two of you can formulate a plan. Good luck, {playerName}.
Destroy Spewspitter's emblem in {POITags}
Defeat the {targetName} Corrupted
Destroy Spewspitter's Corrupted Emblem
Southward March
Investigate key locations to the north that have been taken by the Wardogs. Then report back to Magistrate Wallace in Mourningdale.
"Yes, the Corrupted."
Of course, you helped her recover her vision, and I am grateful for that.\n\nYou've not only avenged Tony, but taken his place. That's why I must ask your help again, to save us from this new menace.
"I'll do whatever I can."
We need to know the Corrupted's strategy before we can accomplish anything.\n\nSearch the Wardog strongholds to the north and bring back anything you can find. I'm in this fight with you, now.
The Wardogs appeared in our territory even before the Shattered Mountain erupted.\n\nI have no idea what they might be planning now.
Hmm. You recovered ore and… compasses? I wonder what these are for?\n\nThe ore suggests they may be mining and stockpiling weapons, but compasses? That makes no sense.
"To coordinate their movements?"
That makes sense, but it still tells us little about their immediate intentions.\n\nI will give these to Gildon and see if she might be able to tell us something. Do come back later.
Loot {itemName} from chests in {POITags}
Defeat the {targetName}s at the {POITags}
Loot {itemName}es from chests in {POITags}
Defeat the {targetName}s at {POITags}
Investigate locations that have been taken by the Wardogs
Travel to {POITags}
Find Lerato's Heirloom Helmet in crates in Ceremony
Recover Lerato's Heirloom Breastplate from the Corrupted in Ceremony
Recover Lerato's Family Sword from the Corrupted in Ceremony
Find Captain McKeys' Shanty Book
Retrieve Captain McKeys' Hurdy Gurdy from ghosts in Smuggler's Cave
Travel to the first site in Pierre's Guidebook
Travel to the second site in Pierre's Guidebook
Travel to the third site in Pierre's Guidebook
Travel to the last site in Pierre's Guidebook
Ode to Aeternum
Pierre Auguste would like new tales of Aeternum, but is too timid to travel himself. Write a collection of odes to the scenic locations described in Pierre's guidebook.
"This place can be both beautiful and terrifying."

That's what I'm told. I even bought a guidebook! 

I admit though, I'm a coward. Quelle folie... 

It must be frightful to die.
"It's definitely a memorable experience."

Just so.

Pity I'll never know the places this guidebook describes. I feel so robbed.

Unless…
"Unless?"
Well, you seem an adventurous type. Are you any sort of artist as well? \n\nIf you would go to each of these places and capture what you find in a poem or a song, I'd be thrilled!
Have you visited the places in my guidebook? \n\nI'm eager to hear of your experiences out in the world!

Ah, you're back! 

I'm burning with anticipation to read your contributions! 

Leilani's stories are wonderful, but she's retired. I yearn for new tales!
"I've written a few pieces for you in your book."
So you have! C'est bon! \n\nNow if you'll excuse me, it's time to drink in the sweetness of your poetry!
Think up an ode to the view.
Dream up a poem about the Ancients' aesthetic.
Concoct a tale of your valiant victories.
Write a song about the journey.
Investigate the location for Ancient artifacts.
Investigate the location for Ancient artifacts.
Defeat the Bladedancer to recover an Ancient artifact.
Investigate the location for Ancient artifacts.
Travel to the first site marked on Leilani's map.
Travel to the second site marked on Leilani's map.
Travel to the third site marked on Leilani's map.
Travel to the first site Leilani marked on your map.
Travel to the second site Leilani marked on your map.
Travel to the third site Leilani marked on your map.
Stone Cold Secrets
Follow Leilani's clues, written on your map, to complete her last adventure and find three lost artifacts of Ancient construction.
"Once? What happened?"
I finally encountered a cliff I could not climb. Old age. \n\nI can't fight like I used to and my bones ache more each day. My adventuring days are pau.
"Pau?"

Done, finished. 

But as I was saying, you've got the look of an adventurer about you. 

If you'd like, I'll give you my notes. See if you can resolve my last adventure.
Are you taking a rest? In-between tasks? \n\nDo let me know if you've found whatever secrets are locked inside those monuments.

Well look at this, Pierre! Our adventurer returns! 

That's a confident swagger if I've ever seen one. 

Tell me what you've discovered!
Look for Pierre at the Soul Shrine to the far north.
Defeat Sunadire Ancients defending the site.
Search Three Sites for Ancient Artifacts.
Look for Pierre at {POITags}.
Find evidence of Pierre's passing through.
Find evidence of Pierre's passing through.
Find evidence of Pierre's passing through.
Look for Pierre at {POITags}.
Look for Pierre at {POITags}.
Place the Artifact in the Impression
Place the Artifact in the Impression
Place the Artifact in the Impression
Defeat the Ancient Guardian
Bring Leilani's order to the Barkeep.
Search for Corruption Emitters at Checkpoint 1
Search for Corruption Emitters at Checkpoint 2
Search for Corruption Emitters at Checkpoint 3
Destroy Malign Nodes
Destroy Malign Nodes
Destroy Malign Nodes
Harvest a Thick Steak
Harvest a Tender Cheek
Harvest a Prime Loin
Butcher Mourning Pigs
Observe the Ancient Lighthouse from the end of the Pier
Return to Leilani with your stories
The Last Mystery
Travel to three locations marked on your map and investigate whether Leilani's key can be used at each.
"What's that?"
They fit together into a larger artifact. \n\nIt's got markings that I believe correspond to some Ancient sites I visited in my adventuring days.
"Do you think it might be a key?"
Aye, you may be right! \n\nWould you test that theory? Even if we are wrong it will make for a great story!
Have you tested that artifact yet? I'm sure it all means something. \n\nWhat mysteries still lie hidden out there?
Look, Pierre! Our stalwart returns! \n\nTell us, was it a key? What mysteries did it unlock?
"It activated the guardians!"
Oh my! I certainly couldn't have predicted that. \n\nBut look how you've come through even so. Tell us all about it.
Amateur Adventurer
Follow the trail of clues to find where Pierre has gone.
Read the note.

My friends! 

Your stories of valor and verve have inspired me! 

Soon I will be back to regale you with tales of my own adventure to the north!
This is the note left by Pierre when he set out for adventure.
Oh thank the heavens, it's you! \n\nI've been stuck here for days! C’est la galère!
Defeat the Wardog Corrupted
Song of the Sea
Find the Captain's lost Shanty Book and Hurdy-Gurdy.
"If this is about money..."

Nothing like that. This be a tragic tale. 

Music’s me soul, y'see. But me crewmates never fancied me shanties. Blamed 'em, in fact, for us having run aground on this rock. 

So they stole me hurdy-gurdy an' threw me out!
"That is tragic!"

For them, aye! The scurvy lot ended up Lost while I'm still here. 

Me music's what saved me. We go together like salt an' the sea. 

But without me hurdy-gurdy an' me songbook, I can't quite recall me tunes…

I don't feel like meself these days. 

Me music be the only thing left to cling to out here. 

Without it, I may just slip away like th' rest o' them…

Dancing dolphins! Me hurdy-gurdy! Ye've found her! 

An' me shanties as well! 

I don't know how I could repay ye.
Village Champion
Recover Lerato's Heirloom armor and sword from the Corrupted in Ceremony and return them to her at the crossroads.
"The Corrupted?"

Who else? 

My father was our town's defender. He died fighting, and the Corrupted took his weapon and his armor. 

I can't move on until I get them back.
"As keepsakes to honor your father's memory?"

No! To train up and return to liberate Ceremony! 

It's my birthright, as daughter of the village champion. 

But I couldn't manage it on my own at the moment.
My father fought them in the streets, but for every one he struck down, five more would take their place. \n\nI must avenge him, but first I need to get his armor back.

You're back! 

And with my father's armor as well! I'd recognize it anywhere! 

You've done me and my father a great kindness.
Travel to the town of Ceremony
Malign Dominion

Find and destroy Malign Nodes at each of three Corrupt checkpoints along the road, then return to Harunobu at the crossroads. Some of these nodes are out of reach, you may need to bring a ranged weapon.
"Are they preparing for an invasion?"

They must be! 

I may be just a hog farmer from Hibbotsfeld, but I recognize purpose when I see it! 

They've locked down the northern road like a Corrupted constabulary!
"What's their insidious plan?"

I'm not sure but they're planting those Malign Nodes everywhere. 

I'd wager destroying those nodes would set them back a few pegs. 

Then again, I'm just a hog farmer.

Ah! Stay back! 

Oh, it's you again. Have you seen what those Corrupted are up to on the roads? 

I'm beginning to worry I'll never see my hogs again!

Yah! You have got to stop startling me like that! 

Did you see what those Corrupted are doing? 

Did you destroy their Malign Nodes?
"Those nasty things just grew right back."
Blast it! What will I do now? \n\nI'm just a hog farmer! My life's work is in Hibbotsfeld!
Makin' Bacon
Harvest Mourning Pigs in Hibbotsfeld for Harunobu and return them to him at the crossroads.
"Your life's work?"

Hogs! 

I'm a hog farmer. Always have been. 

I've got nothing left now! If only I had a way to get some of my precious pork…
"I'm sure I could manage to slaughter a hog or two."
You could go up to my farm and harvest some of the last of my hogs. Those are nice and plump! \n\nAt least then I'd have something to barter with when I show up at the settlement.
Well? Did you go to my farm? \n\nI'd do it myself, but I'm just a hog farmer.

Oh, that's Hibbotsfeld pork if I've ever seen it. 

Look at that marbling! 

It's all in my special regimen of 2 quarts of beer and a massage for each pig, every day!
Travel to Hibbotsfeld
Soul Music
Clear away the Withered around the Ancient Head so that Jan Jaansen can better hear the mysterious voice.
"I don't hear anything."

Are you sure? It's right there, playing at the edge of my hearing. 

But those damned Withered are so loud. I can't hear myself think! 

If only they were gone.
"I could get rid of a few of them."

That would be wonderful! 

I'm Jan Jaansen, bard of some note you know! 

Maybe I'll write a ballad about your heroics!

I almost had it for a moment! 

If only those Withered were driven away… 

It's something like a poem…

I heard it! For but a moment it was clear as the dawn! 

A song of epic proportions, a song of… 

Well I'm not exactly sure yet, but gracious, am I inspired to figure it out!
New Perspective
Get to the end of Presage Pier and look for inspiration for the next stanza of Jan's epic.
"I've been known to be heroic."
Worthy of ballads, I'm sure! Care to take on another task for me? \n\nThe muse compells…
"What does the muse ask?"

Something about stone and sea. At first I was confused, but then I remembered! 

Presage Pier is stone, in the sea! 

Then there was something about a lighthouse…

It all started with that voice, the one in the Ancient Head. 

Are you sure you couldn't hear it? 

It was like a poem, but it was so bewitching. It moves me!
You are indeed a heroic sort, aren't you? \n\nTell me then, what did you find?
Harmonic Resonance
Follow Jan Jaansen's inspiration to the location foretold in Jan's inspiration.
"I still don't hear anything."

But it's in the air, it's all around us! 

I can hear it ringing. 

It's telling me that the secret is at the lighthouse.
"That place is a nightmare!"
Tut, tut! The muse is never wrong. \n\nI'm convinced that you'll find the song for yourself if you follow my intuition.
Jan seems lost in her thoughts. \n\nShe hums a haunting tune.
(You are oddly compelled to touch the Ancient Sculpture, and to your surprise, contact with the smoothed stone reveals a cosmic sense of music. \n\nA wordless vision of vastness, and of escape.)
Follow the route revealed by Jan Jaansen's muse.
Continue along the route revealed by Jan Jaansen's muse.
Go to the final location revealed by Jan Jaansen's muse.
Find Jan Jaansen along the north coast roads.
A Toast to Adventure
Bring Leilani's Special Order to the Bartender in the Mourningdale Tavern.
"A toast?"

Ae! A toast to adventure. 

Faced with adversity, you still rise to the occasion. 

Reminds me of myself, when I was young and wild.
"Alright a toast then!"
I wrote my order down for the bartender. Do me a favor and bring it to him. \n\nI'm sure they'll waste no time in bringing up our order!
Hurry up and bring my order to the bartender, then! \n\nDon't hang about!
What's this? Another order from that woman upstairs? \n\nI thought I just saw her friend leaving…
Bring Leilani's Special Order to the Bartender.
Welcome to Mourningdale
Find Harunobu, recently of Hibbotsfeld.
"The Corruption problem up north is bad!"

So I've heard. 

More and more people falling through here lost their livelihoods. 

Some lost worse!
"Worse?"
No use in dwelling on it.\n\nInstead, why not go greet a couple of them, welcome them to their new home?

Have you checked in with those newcomers yet?

Don't want them feeling left out after all that's happened to them.

Let's show them some Mourningdale hospitality, eh?

Hey it's {PlayerName}!

Great to see you again. Want to try some of this pork?

The facilities here are top notch!
Welcome Harunobu to Mourningdale
The People in the Neighborhood
Bring a sample of Harunobu's roast pork to Lerato.
"I'm glad for you!"

I was at the brink of despair for a time there. 

But, that woman from the crossroads, Lerato? 

She was kind enough to travel here with me.
"That was kind of her."
Now, I'm doing much better. I may not be a hog farmer anymore, but I am a great hog roaster! \n\nDo you mind bringing some of this to good old Lerato? She's here in town.

Hey{PlayerName}! 

Get that meat to Lerato while it's still hot! 

It gets a little greasy when it cools off.
Oh hello, what have you brought me? \n\nAh, bless that Harunobu, he is so kind to me.
Welcome Lerato to Mourningdale with a sample of Harunobu's roast pork.
Head to the town of Ceremony.
Following the Bard's Song
Search the coastal roads for Jan Jaansen
Read the note.

Thanks for the inspiration! 

Here's to the brave soul that helped me to find my way on the roads north of the Settlement! 
You're a real muse. I may write a song just about your great deeds! 

There are still heroes in this world! Let's cross paths again, perhaps in the north? 

J. Jaansen
(Jan Jaansen wrote this note. \n\nCould it be about you?)
It's as though you heard me calling for you from so far away.
Seasoned Adventurer
Race Pierre home to the Mourningdale Settlement
"You should get home."

I intend to! 

I'll just take a moment to catch my breath, then I'll make haste back to my nice warm stool. 

Let's make a race of it! Bet I get back before you!

I've just tightened up my laces and checked my pockets. 

I'll be ready for the road soon. 

What will Leilani think of us when we get back and share our tale?

Well, well! You made it back! 

I thought you might have been faster than me, but here we are! 

Those bluish shrines really make travel convenient, non?
Race Pierre Home to Mourningdale Settlement.
